required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Airway Response to Allergen in Asthmatics (MK-0000-176)
clinical_study.official_title: A Two-Part, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Crossover Trial to Evaluate the Differential Effects of Inhaled Nedocromil, Oral Montelukast, and Inhaled Mometasone on Markers of the Early Airway Response to Allergen in Asthmatics

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the Early Airway Response (EAR) associated change in forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) and plasma 9α-11ß-PGF2 ('9P') after single dose pretreatment of nedocromil, montelukast, and mometasone.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-allergen challenge and 20 minutes after allergen challenge
primary_outcome.description: Maximal percent drop in FEV1 at 20 minutes post allergen challenge

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-allergen challenge and 5 minutes post allergen challenge
primary_outcome.description: Fold change over baseline of plasma 9P at 5 minutes post-allergen challenge

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-allergen challenge and 20 minutes post allergen challenge
primary_outcome.description: Fold change over baseline of plasma 9P at 20 minutes post-allergen challenge

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 2 hours post allergen challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Fold change over baseline in Urinary 9P at 2 hours post allergen challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Allergen-induced Changes in Urinary Leukotriene (LT) E4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 2 hours post allergen challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Fold change over baseline in urinary LTE4 at 2 hours post-allergen challenge
Concentrations of LTC4 in sputum at 2 hours post-allergen challenge
Concentrations of LTD4 in sputum at 2 hours post-allergen challenge
Concentrations of LTE4 in sputum at 2 hours post-allergen challenge

intervention.description: Nedocromil 4 mg, as metered dose inhaler 1 hour prior to allergen challenge
Montelukast single 10 mg tablet administered 2 hours prior to allergen challenge
Mometasone furoate 400 mcg by twisthaler, administered 2 hours prior to allergen challenge
Mometasone placebo twisthaler, Nedocromil placebo metered dose inhaler, Montelukast placebo tablet

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- History of mild to moderate Asthma
- In good general health (except for asthma)
- Stable and free of respiratory infection
- Nonsmoker
- Females highly unlikely to conceive (surgically sterilized, postmenopausal, or agrees to use 2 acceptable methods of birth control)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Nursing mother
- Recent or ongoing upper or lower respiratory tract infection
- Unable to refrain from or anticipates the use of any prescription and non-prescription drugs
- Consumes excessive amounts of alcohol or caffeine
- History of stroke, chronic seizures, or major neurological disorder
- History of cancer
- Received a vaccination within the past 3 weeks

group.title: Placebo-Montelukast-Nedocromil-Mometasone
group.description: Over the course of four 3-day treatment regimens, participants received a single dose of each drug starting with placebo, crossover of nedocromil or montelukast, crossover of nedocromil or montelukast, ending with mometasone; with a 20-day washout between each of the four treatment periods.

group.title: Placebo-Nedocromil-Montelukast-Mometasone
group.description: Over the course of four 3-day treatment regimens, participants received a single dose of each drug starting with placebo, crossover of nedocromil or montelukast, crossover of nedocromil or montelukast, ending with mometasone; with a 20-day washout between each of the four treatment periods.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: Over the course of four 3-day treatment regimens, participants received a single dose of each drug starting with placebo, nedocromil or montelukast, nedocromil or montelukast, ending with mometasone; with a 20-day washout between each of the four treatment periods.

outcome.title: Change in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1)
outcome.description: Maximal percent drop in FEV1 at 20 minutes post allergen challenge
outcome.time_frame: Pre-allergen challenge and 20 minutes after allergen challenge

outcome.description: Concentrations of LTC4 in sputum at 2 hours post-allergen challenge

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: For multicenter studies, subsequent to the multicenter publication, an investigator and colleagues may publish their data independently. Limitations of single site observations should always be described in such a manuscript. The SPONSOR must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission. Any information identified by the SPONSOR as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
